description: The mwana pwo mask is a popular and frequent presence in Chokwe entertainment masquerades. While it represents a female ancestor—symbolizing fertility and the prominent role of women in Chokwe society—the mask is always worn by a male dancer. The features of this particular example, while idealized, suggest the individuality of a portrait, raising the possibility that it may be modeled on a particular woman.
artist_info:
Chokwe
Angola or Democratic Republic of the Congo
Central Africa
title: Female Face Mask (Mwana Pwo)
